Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek pottery plate; interior: on flat rim, hook maeander between bands; bowl glazed; exterior: one blob on edge of rim; reserved underside with two brown lines. Two suspension holes on rim pierced before firing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Interior burnt from the bombing in 194I.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.691)
